headline.main: World Briefing | Africa: Namibia: Threat To Shoot Dismays Rights Group

lead_paragraph: The National Society of Human Rights condemned the minister of defense, Erkki Nghimtina, for threatening to shoot anyone found to be collaborating with rebels from neighboring Angola. Namibia has suffered from attacks by Angolan rebels ever since it decided to allow Angolan soldiers to fight the rebels from Namibian soil. The human rights group condemned the minister's remarks saying such government action would violate the constitution, which bans the death penalty. Rachel L. Swarns (NYT)
abstract: Namibia's minister of defense, Erkki Nghimtina, is condemned by National Society of Human Rights for threatening to shoot anyone found to be collaborating with rebels from neighboring Angola (S)
